TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IUrlHelper

Docs.summary: Defines the contract for the helper to build URLs for ASP.NET MVC within an application.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Action (Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Routing.UrlActionContext actionContext);

abstract member Action : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Routing.UrlActionContext -> string

Docs.param: The context object for the generated URLs for an action method.
Docs.summary: Generates a URL with an absolute path for an action method, which contains the action name, controller name, route values, protocol to use, host name, and fragment specified by . Generates an absolute URL if and are non-null. See the remarks section for important security information.

remarks.para: The value of should be a trusted value. Relying on the value of the current request can allow untrusted input to influence the resulting URI unless the Host header has been validated. See the deployment documentation for instructions on how to properly validate the Host header in your deployment environment.

abstract member Content : string -> string

Docs.param: The virtual path of the content.
Docs.summary: Converts a virtual (relative, starting with ~/) path to an application absolute path.
Docs.remarks: If the specified content path does not start with the tilde (~) character, this method returns unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsLocalUrl (string url);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsLocalUrl(string url) cil managed
Public Function IsLocalUrl (url As String) As Boolean
public: bool IsLocalUrl(System::String ^ url);
abstract member IsLocalUrl : string -> bool

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the URL is local. A URL is considered local if it does not have a host / authority part and it has an absolute path. URLs using virtual paths ('~/') are also local.
Docs.returns: true if the URL is local; otherwise, false.

example.para: For example, the following URLs are considered local: /Views/Default/Index.html ~/Index.html
The following URLs are non-local: ../Index.html http://www.contoso.com/ http://localhost/Index.html

For example, the following URLs are considered local:
/Views/Default/Index.html ~/Index.html

The following URLs are non-local:
../Index.html http://www.contoso.com/ http://localhost/Index.html

Docs.param: The name of the route that is used to generate URL.
An object that contains route values.
Docs.summary: Generates an absolute URL for the specified and route , which contains the protocol (such as "http" or "https") and host name from the current request. See the remarks section for important security information.

remarks.para: This method uses the value of to populate the host section of the generated URI. Relying on the value of the current request can allow untrusted input to influence the resulting URI unless the Host header has been validated. See the deployment documentation for instructions on how to properly validate the Host header in your deployment environment.

remarks.para: The value of should be a trusted value. Relying on the value of the current request can allow untrusted input to influence the resulting URI unless the Host header has been validated.
